tatami.core.agent

Class CompositeAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.core.agent.CompositeAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AgentManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimulationLinkAgent

    public class CompositeAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, AgentManager
    This class reunites the components of an agent in order for components to be able to call each other and for events to be distributed to all components.

    Various agent components -- instances of AgentComponent -- can be added. 'Standard' components have names that are instances of AgentComponent.AgentComponentName. 'Other' (non-standard) components can have any name (TODO). At most one component with a name is allowed (i.e. at most one component per functionality).

    It is this class that handles agent events, by means of the postAgentEvent() method, which disseminates an event to all components, which handle it by means of registered handles (each component registers a handle for an event with itself). See AgentComponent.

    A composite agent instance is its own AgentManager.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • CompositeAgent

        public CompositeAgent()

    • Method Detail

      • addComponent

        public CompositeAgent addComponent(AgentComponent component)
        Adds a component to the agent that has been configured beforehand. The agent will register with the component, as parent.

        The component will be identified by the agent by means of its getComponentName method. Only one instance per name (functionality) will be allowed.

        Parameters:
        component - - the AgentComponent instance to add.
        Returns:
        the agent instance itself. This can be used to continue adding other components.

      • removeComponent

        public AgentComponent removeComponent(AgentComponent.AgentComponentName name)
        Removes an existing component of the agent.

        The method will call the method getComponentName() of the component with a null parameter.

        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the component to remove (as instance of AgentComponent.AgentComponentName.
        Returns:
        a reference to the just-removed component instance.

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Starts the lifecycle of the agent. All components will receive an AGENT_START event.
        Specified by:
        start in interface AgentManager
        Returns:
        true if the event has been successfully posted. See postAgentEvent().

      • exit

        public boolean exit()
        Instructs the agent to unload all components and exit. All components will receive an AGENT_EXIT event.

        No events will be successfully received after this event has been posted.

        Returns:
        true if the event has been successfully posted. See postAgentEvent().

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Alias for exit().
        Specified by:
        stop in interface AgentManager
        Returns:
        true if the agent was stopped without error. false otherwise.

      • setPlatformLink

        public boolean setPlatformLink(PlatformLoader.PlatformLink link)
        Description copied from interface: AgentManager
        Creates a link from the agent to the platform, which will facilitate the invocation of specific platform functionality. The passed instance may be the platform itself, or some agent-specific instance, depending on the platform.

        This method can usually by called only when the agent is not running.

        Specified by:
        setPlatformLink in interface AgentManager
        Parameters:
        link - - the link to the platform.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • getAgentName

        public java.lang.String getAgentName()
        Returns the name of the agent. It can either be a name that has been set through the AGENT_NAME parameter, or the name of the Jade agent underpinning the JadeComponent, if any.
        Specified by:
        getAgentName in interface AgentManager
        Returns:
        the name of the agent.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the agent is currently in RUNNING state. In case components are added during this state, they must consider that the agent is already running and no additional AgentEvent.AgentEventType.AGENT_START events will be issued.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is currently RUNNING; false otherwise.

      • canAddComponents

        public boolean canAddComponents()
        Checks if the state of the agent allows adding components. Components should not be added in intermediary states in which the agent is starting or stopping.
        Returns:
        true if in the current state components can be added.
